intro: Senecio pardalianches, commonly known as the Canary Island groundsels, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Senecio pardalianches is often found in open habitats such as coastal areas and mountainous regions.
